headers.subject: [tosdr:1970] You release Tumblr from liability

html:
You release, to the fullest extent permitted by law, Tumblr, its directors, officers, shareholders, employees, representatives, consultants, agents, suppliers, and/or distributors from responsibility, liability, claims, demands, and/or damages (actual and consequential) of every kind and nature, known and unknown, arising out of or in any way connected with the following:

  • Disputes between Subscribers, including those between you and other Subscribers.
  • Third party sites and services, including content found on such sites and services.
  • Disputes concerning any use of or action taken using your Account by you or a third party.
  • Claims relating to the unauthorized access to any data communications or Content stored under or relating to your Account, including unauthorized use or alteration of such communications or your Content.
  • Claims relating to in any way to any face-to-face meetings in any way related to Tumblr at any venues ("Meetups"), including without limitation claims related to the actions or omissions of any Subscribers or third parties who organize, attend, or are otherwise involved in any Meetups; see our Meetups page for more information. Tumblr does not sponsor, oversee, or in any manner control Meetups.

There's an additional clause related to California residents:

If you are a California resident, you waive California Civil Code รยง1542, which says: "A general release does not extend to claims which the creditor does not know or suspect to exist in his favor at the time of executing the release, which if known by him must have materially affected his settlement with the debtor."

http://www.tumblr.com/policy/en/terms_of_service 

--
tosdr.org | twitter.com/tosdr | github.com/tosdr

subject: You release Tumblr from liability
text:
>
> You release, to the fullest extent permitted by law, Tumblr, its 
> directors, officers, shareholders, employees, representatives, consultants, 
> agents, suppliers, and/or distributors from responsibility, liability, 
> claims, demands, and/or damages (actual and consequential) of every kind 
> and nature, known and unknown, arising out of or in any way connected with 
> the following:
>
>    - Disputes between Subscribers, including those between you and other 
>    Subscribers.
>    - Third party sites and services, including content found on such 
>    sites and services.
>    - Disputes concerning any use of or action taken using your Account by 
>    you or a third party.
>    - Claims relating to the unauthorized access to any data 
>    communications or Content stored under or relating to your Account, 
>    including unauthorized use or alteration of such communications or your 
>    Content.
>    - Claims relating to in any way to any face-to-face meetings in any 
>    way related to Tumblr at any venues ("*Meetups*"), including without 
>    limitation claims related to the actions or omissions of any Subscribers or 
>    third parties who organize, attend, or are otherwise involved in any 
>    Meetups; see our Meetups page <http://www.tumblr.com/meetups> for more 
>    information. Tumblr does not sponsor, oversee, or in any manner control 
>    Meetups.
>
>
There's an additional clause related to California residents:

If you are a California resident, you waive California Civil Code รยง1542, 
> which says: "A general release does not extend to claims which the creditor 
> does not know or suspect to exist in his favor at the time of executing the 
> release, which if known by him must have materially affected his settlement 
> with the debtor."


http://www.tumblr.com/policy/en/terms_of_service
